fields.rendered_content: Jane snuggles down on mom for a power nap before bedtime. Ah, to be six months old...

fields.title: Sleeping J
fields.content: Jane snuggles down on mom for a power nap before bedtime. Ah, to be six months old...

fields.rendered_content:
I was doing animal chores after our most recent blizzard here in Maine and noticed Willa out testing the boundaries of their enclosure. The snow having buried the line, Willa quickly discovered she had nothing stopping her from wandering around the yard. When I went back into the house to get more water, who followed me? Ah, Willa, you sly pig.

After the pigs second break-out and one attempt at clearing off the line, the pigs were whisked away to the horse stalls where they will spend the next few days until we get a melt and more of the line can be cleared off. I feel like farm work is 90% routine chores and 10% triage.
